description: System tray should be baked in, it is sad to have to rely on a third party app for a must have feature, even the windows version has it...
It downloaded, launched, I set it to start on system start up. It is not running; no evidence that it's running in the background. Cannot now launch it. Disappointing.
I was searching an app for this task since forever, and it gets the job done perfectly.
summary: A must if you use Thunderbird

description: problems using system tray

Was looking for such thing (a light-weight email checker, either a part of email client or separate) since last few years because Thunderbird is too heavy to always run on the background. Good to see Ubuntu recommnding this in Store.
Blocked to use system tray on fedora 32
summary: Blocked to use system tray on fedora 32

description: Only lacking feature is the ability to minimise Thunderbird when clicking the Close button. But the 'Minimize on Close' TB add-on does that and so these two work together nicely.
summary: Works well, does what it says

description: Really pleased to have a way to minimize Thunderbird to the system tray. I like to leave Thunderbird open all the time, and the options on Birdtray provide a lot of flexibility.
Great app for thunderbird love it!a
summary: Great app for thunderbird love it!

description: GUI is unresponsive, takes 20 seconds between registered clicks. The default notification color and configuration is atrocious and is basically the same color as the icon making it unreadable. Delete delete delete delete better off without it

Since the demise of the firetray-addon I was looking for a substitude. This is the perfect replacement and is also independent of thunderbird extensions and update-policy. It also features custom icons which is importatnt to me.
Exactly what I wanted. Simple to set up and just works! Kinda surprised that Thunderbird did not have something like Birdtray already built in.
This is a very helpful app for those who care for their unread email messages.

Te deja leer correos desde el servidor y también puedes conectarlo a Gmail, Hotmail y Yahoo para leer tus correos. Otra maravilla es que puedes conectar los calendarios de los correos del servidor via CalDAV. 
Para tener el correo en diferentes maquinas solo sacas los archivos de la carpeta Thunderbird y los llevas en una USB a la otra maquina, copias y pegas en el mismo folder y listo. Ya tienes todos tus correos sincronizados en otra maquina.
summary: Muy buena app para leer correos y conectar calendarios

description: Does what is intended.
Finally a tray workaround for TB! Many thanks! My only issues are that: 1) the app cannot run local binaries (from /usr/bin for example), and the app crashes when closed after TB is closed first.

I'm running Debian 10 + Gnome 3.30.2 and I needed to start Birdtray from the command-line this way:

  flatpak run --own-name='org.kde.*' com.ulduzsoft.Birdtray

Maybe unrelated, but I also ran this command: `export -n SESSION_MANAGER`. I have no idea if it's required and what it does.. Use it at your own risk!
summary: Aditionnal steps required to make it appear in the tray

description: why isn't this just built into thunderbird to begin with?
summary: so good it makes me wonder..

description:

This tool is really useful than kdocker.

summary: It works for the most part

description: great application, but it didn't work after i upgraded my ubuntu to 21.04

Great app, which finally gives us a basic feature for Thunderbird. Why the Thunderbird team won't give us a tray icon as a part of Thunderbird is an unresolved mystery. Luckily, there are other people picking up the slack and providing basic features.
hello, i saw that has appear a new version, why we can`t make the update from ubuntu software ?
does not work with non flatpack thunderbird even with all perms granted
summary: does not work with non flatpack thunderbird
